intro: Acianthella amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping acianthella, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of eastern Australia. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and its attractive, small, white or pinkish flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and clasping, wrapping around the stems, which gives it its common name. Acianthella amplexicaulis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
